arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients ventilated with zero end expiratory pressure (ZEEP)
arm_group.description: patients undergoing gynecologic laparoscopic surgery ventilated at zero end expiratory pressure

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients ventilated with positive end expiratory pressure
arm_group.description: patients undergoing gynecologic laparoscopic surgery ventilated at PEEP
patients undergoing gynecologic laparoscopic surgery undergoing recruitment plus PEEP

brief_summary.textblock:
Atelectasis involving declive areas often occurs during general anesthesia and may persist
      postoperatively. This phenomenon could be amplified by pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg
      position. Hypothesis: To evaluate whether the shape of the airway pressure-time curve,
      Stress Index (SI), during constant flow inflation can lead ventilator setting during general
      anesthesia.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Ventilatory Strategies During Laparoscopic Surgery

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients ventilated with zero end expiratory pressure (ZEEP)
intervention.intervention_name: First arm: patients ventilated with zero end expiratory pressure

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients ventilated with positive end expiratory pressure
intervention.intervention_name: Patients ventilated with Positive End Expiratory Pressure
Patients ventilated with Positive End Expiratory Pressure plus Recruitment maneuver

clinical_study.official_title: Re-expansion of Atelectasis During Laparoscopic Surgery. Recruitment Maneuver vs Positive End-expiratory Pressure: a Randomized Study

other_outcome.time_frame: Continuous evaluation during the time of surgery

primary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous evaluation during time of surgery. Partecipants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 1 weeks
